intro: Viburnum × bodnantense, commonly known as the snowball viburnum, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It is characterized by its clusters of fragrant, white flowers that bloom in early spring, creating a striking visual display. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that turn yellow in the fall, adding to its seasonal appeal. It thrives in partial to full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for a variety of garden settings. Viburnum × bodnantense is also valued for its ornamental berries and its ability to attract pollinators.
